lead_paragraph: KAYE--Honorable Judith. The NYU School of Law mourns the passing of our distinguished alumna, the Honorable Judith Kaye '62. Judge Kaye, who served for 25 years on the New York Court of Appeals and was its Chief Judge from 1993 to 2008, was a trailblazer for women, a brilliant jurist, and a vocal advocate for legal reform. She was also a deeply committed member of the NYU Law community. In addition to serving as a trustee in the 1980s and '90s, she was an advisory board member of our Center on Civil Justice; a director of our Institute for Judicial Administration; and recipient of nearly all of our most distinguished awards for alumni achievement and service. We are grateful for her life and deeply saddened by her loss. NYU School of Law Trevor Morrison, Dean 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  KAYE, HONORABLE JUDITH
